intro: Hirculus prattii, commonly known as the Pratts' goatweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, thriving in dry to moderately moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
